intro: Vittadinia triloba var. pterochaeta, commonly known as the hairy false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dandelion-like appearance with yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture. It is an annual or biennial herb that produces small, wind-dispersed seeds.
